alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 12:59PM PST until February 23 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches for storm total snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches. Locally higher snowfall amounts will fall around Yacolt and Amboy, which will most likely end up in the 6 to 12 inch range. Winds will gust as high as 25 to 35 mph near the mouth of the Gorge later this evening and overnight and result in areas of blowing snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. * WHERE...Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 1 AM PST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the evening commute. Heavy snow and lighter winds across the northeastern half of Clark County, particularly around Heisson, Venersborg, Yacolt and Amboy may result in down trees and power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will generally fall above 200-300 feet and higher in elevation. Temperatures will gradually fall this afternoon and lead to any water and slush on surfaces freezing quickly this evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
